fu.polyarea

Class LineArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.polyarea.LineArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LineArea
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a line area (i.e. a collection of line strings).
    Author:
    Jörg Roth
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toString

      • toExtendedString

        public java.lang.String toExtendedString()
        Creates an exteded text version of the line area. Extended means that additional information such as number of satellites, HDOP, DGPS indicator and timestamp are dumped, if available. They only are available, if the positions area stored with GPSMeasurement objects and not only with GPSPosition objects. Note that GPSMeasurement is a subclass of GPSPosition thus can be used to create LineArea objects. If LineArea is constructed of GPSPosition objects, toExtededString produces the same output as toString.

      • fromString

      • minimalDistanceToCoordinate

        public double minimalDistanceToCoordinate(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate _coord)
        Calculates the minimal distance the lineArea to the passed _coord.
        Parameters:

      • print

        public void print()

      • getDirectionOfLineAreaAtPoint

        public double getDirectionOfLineAreaAtPoint(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate _coord)
        Returns an angle of the LineArea's direction nearest to the point _coord. Two points of the LineArea are determined which have minimal distance to _coord. The angle described by a straight line formed by the previously calculated points is then determined and returned.
        Parameters:
        _coord - A Coordinate.
        Returns:
        An angle (in radian) of the LineArea's direction at the closest point to _coord.

      • calculateAngle

        protected double calculateAngle(GPSPosition _position1,
                    GPSPosition _position2)
        Calculates the angle of a straight line defined by two points.
        Parameters:
        _position1 - A Point.
        _position2 - A Point.
        Returns:
        An angle in radian which is described by a straight line through _position1 and _position2.
